alert.note: Alert for Wabasha (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 19 at 9:17PM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in La Crosse WI has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Minnesota...Wisconsin... Mississippi River Near Alma Dam 4 affecting Wabasha and Buffalo Counties. .Heavy rain combined with melting snow well north of the area has increased the river levels. It may reach flood stage late this weekend. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Mississippi River Near Alma Dam 4. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 15.2 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 1200 PM CDT.
